item.title: Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S10644-10645)

item.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 240.
Reported by the Committee on Foreign Affairs. H. Rept. 111-622.
Reported by the Committee on Foreign Affairs. H. Rept. 111-622.
Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 23 - 22.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.name: War crimes, genocide, crimes against humanity

summary.text: Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution - Calls upon the President: (1) to ensure that U.S. foreign policy reflects appropriate understanding and sensitivity concerning issues related to human rights, ethnic cleansing, and genocide documented in the U.S. record relating to the Armenian Genocide and the consequences of the failure to realize a just resolution; and (2) in the President's annual message commemorating the Armenian Genocide, to characterize the systematic and deliberate annihilation of 1.5 million Armenians as genocide and to recall the proud history of U.S. intervention in opposition to the Armenian Genocide.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution - Calls upon the President: (1) to ensure that U.S. foreign policy reflects appropriate understanding and sensitivity concerning issues related to human rights, ethnic cleansing, and genocide documented in the U.S. record relating to the Armenian Genocide and the consequences of the failure to realize a just resolution; and (2) in the President's annual message commemorating the Armenian Genocide, to characterize the systematic and deliberate annihilation of 1.5 million Armenians as genocide and to recall the proud history of U.S. intervention in opposition to the Armenian Genocide.

bill.title: Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution

item.title: Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution
Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution

item.titleType: Short Titles as Reported to House
item.title: Affirmation of the United States Record on the Armenian Genocide Resolution

Calling upon the President to ensure that the foreign policy of the United States reflects appropriate understanding and sensitivity concerning issues related to human rights, ethnic cleansing, and genocide documented in the United States record relating to the Armenian Genocide, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 240.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
